revised_title: A Description of a Severe Hailstorm and Its Effects Near Rotherham, Yorkshire
tldr: A letter from Ralph Thoresby describes a severe hailstorm that occurred near Rotherham, Yorkshire, in 1711. The storm caused significant damage to glass windows, crops, and livestock. Hailstones ranged from 3 to 5 inches in circumference and were mostly oblong in shape.
